thread.title: Couple sentenced for beating cabbie in drug-and-alcohol fuelled rage - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Couple sentenced for beating cabbie in drug-and-alcohol fuelled rage - Yahoo7

author: Cameron Price
title: Couple sentenced for beating cabbie in drug-and-alcohol fuelled rage - Yahoo7
text:
Share Couple sentenced for beating cabbie in drug-and-alcohol fuelled rage - Yahoo7 A man who stomped on the head of a defenceless taxi driver in a drug-and-alcohol fuelled rage will spend at least two years behind bars. Close Couple sentenced over Taxi driver stomping UP NEXT VIDEO Couple sentenced over Taxi driver stomping. Source: 7 News Couple sentenced over Taxi driver stomping 
His girlfriend will also do time for her role in last year's brutal attack at a Woolooware service station, in Sydney's south, but the pair are appealing their sentences. 
Taxi driver Nadeem Usman was kicked, punched and dragged from his cab by the couple. 
As he tried to escape the cabbie was met with a flurry of fists, knocking him to the ground. Jay Belgrove beat a taxi driver. Source: 7 News Two teens rushed to save Nadeem Usman from the attack, but they were also set upon. Source: 7 News 
After a blow to the head he blacked out. 
Two teenagers who saw what was happening ran to help but they were also set upon. Belgrove beat the defenceless cabbie. Source: 7 News He then stomped on his head, fracturing an eye socket. Source: 7 News 
Then Mr Usman had his head stomped so hard his eye socket was fractured. 
In court Jay Belgrove and Georgia Lee Pickett both pleaded guilty to the violent attack that occurred last June. Belgrove was sentenced to a minimum two years eight months. Source: 7 News 
Before handing out hefty penalties, Magistrate Glenn Bartley said, "Taxi drivers have the right to work without being violently set upon. 
"When he was on the ground, he was motionless and potentially dying. Thankfully, he didn't." He will appeal the sentence. Source: 7 News 
Belgrove received a minimum two years eight months jail while Pickett was sentenced to ten months. 
The pair plans to appeal their sentences. 
Mr Usman was not in court but it understood he stopped driving taxis shortly after the assault.
